wcag-captions-background-color.$description: WCAG 1.2.4 (AA v2.0) - Set the background color of the live closed captions for optimal contrast and readability.

wcag-captions-foreground-color.$description: WCAG 1.2.4 (AA v2.0) - Set the text foreground color of the live closed captions for optimal contrast and readability.

wcag-captions-size-multiplier.$description: WCAG 1.2.4 (AA v2.0) - Maximum text scaling factor to support readability without loss of content or functionality.

wcag-contrast-background-color.$description: WCAG 1.4.3 (AA v2.0) - Ensures text and background have a contrast ratio of at least 4.5:1.

wcag-contrast-foreground-color.$description: WCAG 1.4.3 (AA v2.0) - Ensures text and background have a contrast ratio of at least 4.5:1.

wcag-text-resize-max-pct.$description: WCAG 1.4.4 (AA v2.0) - Except for captions and images of text, text can be resized without assistive technology up to 200 percent without loss of content or functionality.

wcag-visual-text-foreground-color.$description: WCAG 1.4.8 (AAA v2.0) - Allows users to select foreground color for text to improve readability and visual comfort.

wcag-visual-text-background-color.$description: WCAG 1.4.8 (AAA v2.0) - Allows users to select background color for text, enhancing contrast and readability.

wcag-max-text-characters-latin-ch.$description: WCAG 1.4.8 (AAA v2.0) - Maximum number of characters per line to improve readability, set to 80 for Latin scripts. Note: 1 ch unit is relative to the average character advance of a narrow glyph in the element's font, as represented by the '0' (ZERO, U+0030) glyph.

wcag-max-text-characters-cjk-ch.$description: WCAG 1.4.8 (AAA v2.0) - Maximum number of characters per line to improve readability, set to 40 for Chinese, Japanese, and Korean scripts. Note: 1 ch unit is relative to the average character advance of a narrow glyph in the element's font, as represented by the 'ã€‡' (Japanese ZERO, U+3007) the Ideographic Number Zero glyph.

wcag-text-line-spacing-multiplier.$description: WCAG 1.4.8 (AAA v2.0) - Minimum line spacing (leading) within paragraphs, at least space-and-a-half.

wcag-text-paragraph-spacing-multiplier.$description: WCAG 1.4.8 (AAA v2.0) - Minimum paragraph spacing, at least 1.5 times the line spacing.

wcag-text-resize-no-scroll.$description: WCAG 1.4.8 (AAA v2.0) - Text can be resized up to 200 percent without horizontal scrolling on a full-screen window.

wcag-reflow-max-height-px.$description: WCAG 1.4.10 (AA v2.1) - For content that requires horizontal scrolling (e.g., text written vertically), the content should be presentable at a height equivalent to 256 CSS pixels. The 256 CSS pixels height is equivalent to a starting viewport height of 1024 CSS pixels at 400% zoom. The criterion allows for parts of the content that require two-dimensional layout (e.g., images, diagrams, videos, games, data tables, and interfaces with toolbars) to have two-dimensional scrolling.

wcag-reflow-max-width-px.$description: WCAG 1.4.10 (AA v2.1) - For content that requires vertical scrolling, the content should be presentable at a width equivalent to 320 CSS pixels. The 320 CSS pixels width is equivalent to a starting viewport width of 1280 CSS pixels at 400% zoom. The criterion allows for parts of the content that require two-dimensional layout (e.g., images, diagrams, videos, games, data tables, and interfaces with toolbars) to have two-dimensional scrolling.

wcag-reflow-max-zoom-pct.$description: WCAG 1.4.10 (AA v2.1) - The content should be presentable without loss of information or functionality, and without requiring scrolling in two dimensions (horizontally and vertically). The intent of this Success Criterion is to support people with low vision who need to enlarge text and read it in a single column. When the browser zoom is used to scale content to 400%, it reflows - i.e., it is presented in one column so that scrolling in more than one direction is not necessary.

wcag-line-height-pct.$description: WCAG 1.4.12 (AA v2.1) - Line height (line spacing) set to at least 150% of the font size to enhance readability.

wcag-paragraph-spacing-pct.$description: WCAG 1.4.12 (AA v2.1) - Spacing following paragraphs set to at least 200% of font size to separate text blocks effectively.

wcag-letter-spacing-pct.$description: WCAG 1.4.12 (AA v2.1) - Letter spacing (tracking) set to at least 12% of the font size to prevent crowding and improve legibility. Note: Only apply this token in combination with the 'wcag-word-spacing-pct' token.

wcag-word-spacing-pct.$description: WCAG 1.4.12 (AA v2.1) - Word spacing set to at least 16% of the font size to enhance readability and reduce visual crowding of text. Note: Only apply this token in combination with the 'wcag-letter-spacing-pct' token.

wcag-line-height-multiplier.$description: WCAG 1.4.12 (AA v2.1) - Line height (line spacing) set to at least 1.5 times the font size to enhance readability.

wcag-paragraph-spacing-multiplier.$description: WCAG 1.4.12 (AA v2.1) - Spacing following paragraphs set to at least 2 times the font size to separate text blocks effectively.

wcag-letter-spacing-multiplier.$description: WCAG 1.4.12 (AA v2.1) - Letter spacing (tracking) set to at least 0.12 times the font size to prevent crowding and improve legibility. Note: only apply this token in combination with the 'wcag-word-spacing-multiplier' token.

wcag-word-spacing-multiplier.$description: WCAG 1.4.12 (AA v2.1) - Word spacing set to at least 0.16 times the font size to enhance readability and reduce visual crowding of text. Note: only apply this token in combination with the 'wcag-letter-spacing-multiplier' token.

wcag-hover-focus-animation-style.$description: WCAG 1.4.13 (AA v2.1) - Specifies the animation style ('fade', 'slide', 'none') used when additional content appears or disappears, enhancing the user experience without compromising accessibility. Ensures that content visible on hover or focus is also accessible through keyboard navigation, particularly relevant for custom tooltips, sub-menus, and other non-modal popups that appear on hover or focus, as these elements can pose accessibility challenges if not implemented correctly.

wcag-hover-focus-content-delay-ms.$description: WCAG 1.4.13 (AA v2.1) - Specifies the delay time in milliseconds before the additional content disappears after focus or hover is removed, providing sufficient time for interaction without sudden changes. Ensures that content visible on hover or focus is also accessible through keyboard navigation, particularly relevant for custom tooltips, sub-menus, and other non-modal popups that appear on hover or focus, as these elements can pose accessibility challenges if not implemented correctly.

wcag-focus-visible-color.$description: WCAG 2.4.7 (AA v2.0) - Color for focus indicators that ensures high visibility when elements receive focus.

wcag-focus-visible-outline-width-px.$description: WCAG 2.4.7 (AA v2.0) - Width of the outline used for focus indicators to ensure visibility.

wcag-focus-visible-outline-style.$description: WCAG 2.4.7 (AA v2.0) - Style of the outline used for focus indicators (e.g., solid, dashed).

focus-indicator-width-px.$description: WCAG 2.4.7 (AA v2.0) - Specifies the width of the focus indicator in pixels to ensure it is clearly visible.

focus-indicator-style.$description: WCAG 2.4.7 (AA v2.0) - Specifies the style of the focus indicator, e.g., solid, dotted, dashed.

focus-indicator-outline-offset-px.$description: WCAG 2.4.7 (AA v2.0) - Specifies the outline offset of the focus indicator from the element border in pixels to prevent visual merging.

focus-indicator-radius-px.$description: WCAG 2.4.7 (AA v2.0) - Specifies the border-radius of the focus indicator in pixels to match design aesthetics.

wcag-minimum-target-size-px.$description: WCAG 2.5.5 (AAA v2.1) - The main requirement of this criterion is that the size of the target for pointer inputs should be at least 44 by 44 CSS pixels, except in certain cases. The exceptions are: Equivalent: If there is an equivalent link or control on the same page that is at least 44 by 44 CSS pixels. Inline: If the target is part of a sentence or block of text. Note: This is a Level AAA criterion, which means it is a recommended best practice. However, adhering to this criterion can significantly enhance the user experience for a wide range of users, especially those with disabilities or impairments that affect their ability to interact with small targets.

wcag-target-size-minimum-px.$description: WCAG 2.5.8 (AA v2.2) - Specifies the minimum size for target areas of pointer inputs, ensuring ease of interaction.
